707000f-b.text:
(1)
2201-2223 Surf Ave., north side, between West 23rd and 22nd Streets. No. 2223 is in the foreground. The center building was the temporary branch office of the Brooklyn Borough Gas Cog, distinguished by its flagpole. This building was formerly known as "Grand View".
January 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
The same.
December 31, 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(3)
A limited view.
December 31, 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(4)
The same as No. 3, after the Coney Island fire. Note the destruction of the former "Grand View".
August 8, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
707000f-b.folder: Surf Ave. & 22nd St. W., Brooklyn, NY

706999f-a.text:
Surf Ave., south side, between West 22nd and 23rd Streets; showing reaults of a fire in 1932, at Coney Ialand.
August 6, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
706999f-a.folder: Surf Ave. & 22nd St. W., Brooklyn, NY

702650f-b.text:
West 22nd Street, at and adjoining the S. E. corner of Surf Avenue, showing several bungalows being demolished for the improvement of the area. The view is from Surf Avenue.
January, 1924
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection
(2)
The same site, years later, showing the Socony gasoline station and garage and the upper floor of a residence which replaced the old bungalows.
September 17, 1939
P. L. Sperr
